intro: Pleioceras barteri var. zenkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a popular ornamental plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that can be either upright or trailing, depending on the variety. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ability to produce offsets makes it easy to propagate and maintain in home environments.
